example_sentence: The ancient Romans used an abacus for calculations.
The abandonee of the shipwreck was rescued by a passing freighter.
He would not abase himself by apologizing to his accuser.
She was not at all abashed by his open admiration.
The landlord offered a rent abatement due to the ongoing construction noise.
Animal welfare activists protested outside the abattoir.
The king decided to abdicate his throne in favor of his son.
His aberrant behavior was a cause for concern among his colleagues.
The sudden drop in temperature was an aberration for this time of year.
He was accused of aiding and abetting the criminals.
The plans for the new building are being held in abeyance until the funding is secured.
She abhors any form of discrimination.
You must abide by the rules of the agreement.
The refugees were living in abject poverty.
He was forced to abjure his former beliefs.
The ritual involved a ceremonial ablution before prayer.
She abnegated her rights to the inheritance.
Slavery was abolished in the 19th century.
I abominate cruelty towards animals.
The aboriginal peoples of Australia have a rich cultural history.
The peace talks proved to be abortive.
The rough rope abraded his skin.
The editor decided to abridge the lengthy novel.
The government sought to abrogate the old treaty.
The abscission of leaves occurs in autumn.
